medical_history.chief_complaint: Diagnosis of primary adrenal insufficiency during infancy or childhood in four 46,XX patients with nonclassic lipoid congenital adrenal hyperplasia.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Thelarche and menarche occurred spontaneously from 10 to 11 years and 12 to 14 years of age, respectively. Their menstrual cycles were regular at almost one-month intervals. Patients had varying degrees of menstrual irregularities and complications, with two patients successfully maintaining pregnancies without progesterone replacement therapy.
medical_history.past_medical_history: All patients had a diagnosis of primary adrenal insufficiency in infancy or childhood. Patient 1 had initial symptoms at 6 years, patient 2's age at onset is not specified, patient 3 had a history of high fever and lethargy, and patient 4 had a febrile seizure at 6 years.
medical_history.family_history: Patient 3's elder sister died at 10 months from unknown etiology. Patient 4 had a younger brother who died at age 2 from acute encephalopathy. The family history of other patients is not specified.
